## getServiceAccount Result {#result}

The following output properties are available:



{{% choosable language csharp %}}

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Optional. A user-specified, human-readable description of the service account. The maximum length is 256 UTF-8 bytes.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="disabled_csharp">
<a href="#disabled_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Disabled</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Whether the service account is disabled.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="displayname_csharp">
<a href="#displayname_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Display<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Optional. A user-specified, human-readable name for the service account. The maximum length is 100 UTF-8 bytes.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="email_csharp">
<a href="#email_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Email</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The email address of the service account.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The resource name of the service account. Use one of the following formats: * `projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{EMAIL_ADDRESS}` * `projects/{PROJECT_ID}/serviceAccounts/{UNIQUE_ID}` As an alternative, you can use the `-` wildcard character instead of the project ID: * `projects/-/serviceAccounts/{EMAIL_ADDRESS}` * `projects/-/serviceAccounts/{UNIQUE_ID}` When possible, avoid using the `-` wildcard character, because it can cause response messages to contain misleading error codes. For example, if you try to get the service account `projects/-/serviceAccounts/fake@example.com`, which does not exist, the response contains an HTTP `403 Forbidden` error instead of a `404 Not Found` error.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="oauth2clientid_csharp">
<a href="#oauth2clientid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Oauth2Client<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The OAuth 2.0 client ID for the service account.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="project_csharp">
<a href="#project_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Project</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the project that owns the service account.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="uniqueid_csharp">
<a href="#uniqueid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Unique<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The unique, stable numeric ID for the service account. Each service account retains its unique ID even if you delete the service account. For example, if you delete a service account, then create a new service account with the same name, the new service account has a different unique ID than the deleted service account.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
